title: Print, "Epitaphe de marbre et bronze de Mr. le Baron de Bezenval (Epitaph in marble and bronze for Baron de Bezenval), plate 100, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1748
signed: Signed in plate, lower left: J. A. Meissonnier inv. et perfecit; lower right: Huquier Sculp. et ex rue St. Jacques. CPR.
inscribed: Inscribed in plate, upper right: 100; lower center: Epitaphe de marbre et bronze de Mr. le Baron de Bezenval / executé a St. Sulpice de Paris
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Epitaph stands in front of fluted pilaster and flanked by branches. Starting with lower section, crown of thorns sits framed by a shell; a larger panel of veined marble topped by family crest illustrates a ram, baby, and two horseshoes and topped by a crown. Flanking this a scroll and a dagger. Below, hangs a medal of honor, on right a helmet. Above, portrait with inscription ANIMUS PAR ORI; portrait framed by grapevines and ribbon. Finial at the top with two points.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Epitaphe de marbre et bronze de Mr. le Baron de Bezenval (Epitaph in marble and bronze for Baron de Bezenval), plate 100, from Oeuvres de Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier (Works by Juste-Aurèle Meissonnier)", 1748.
1748. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-212-58.
